para: DeltaRGB is a object, used as a parameter when selecting pixels in &images;. It specifies the difference between two colors by the differences between their red, green, and blue components, taken separately. The difference between two colors is less than DeltaRGB if the absolute value of the differences in their red, green, and blue components are less than delta_red, delta_green, and delta_blue, respectively. The deltas are floating point numbers between 0 and 1, inclusive, where 0 indicates no intensity difference and 1 indicates the maximum possible difference.
